Recap: Josh, Cassie and RJ find H.B.'s old desk in an antique shop. Inside the desk Josh finds H.B.'s blueprints for a privately funded medical center for soldiers. He talks with the owner of the land, Buck, about turning Cross Creek into a ranch-style medical center and Buck refuses. Josh asks Cassie to, "Use your past", to get the guy to agree. Thinking Josh meant her past as a hooker, she blasts him, but Buck leaves, agreeing to the project. They shake hands on a deal for the project. Dinah and Harley arrive at the shooting scene. Mallet has been shot and Gus just stares into space, having difficulty focusing. He has flashbacks of taking pills prior to the stakeout. Gus and Mallet give conflicting reports about exactly what happened. Harley tells Gus that she knows he is high and that she knows he didn't have a deposition with the nurse. She is irate that Gus endangered himself and Mallet. A very contrite Gus finally admits that, "I needed to take them, I needed to". A very devastated Gus realizes he needs help and Harley agrees to help him as she takes him in for rehab treatment. Mallet is treated for a shoulder wound at Cedars while a worried Dinah stands by his side. The only thing she can do for Mallet is donate blood, but passes out as the nurse comes with the syringes and needles. When she comes to, Rick announces that Mallet is going to be o.k. and that Mallet told him to tell her he loved her.

Lizzie asks a so-called friend who works for her uncle-doctor, an OB-GYN, to fabricate that Lizzie has been a patient of his for a while. Coop follows her to the office, suspicious of her. Coop asks to see Lizzie's medical records and the friend tells him that Lizzie has been a patient for a month. He leaves thinking Lizzie is an established patient. At Company, Olivia tries to get Frank and Buzz back on speaking terms and Frank receives a call about an officer shot. She tells an emotional story to Buzz about when her father was killed in a freak accident as a police officer. Lizzie and Coop walk into Company and tell Ava they need to talk as Alan and Beth walk in. Lizzie announces to a shocked audience that she and Henry are pregnant. Alan attacks Coop, choking him.
Transcript: Josh: Wow.
Cassie: It's here. It's here, and it looks great.
Josh: It's so much smaller than I remember it being. I don't even know how he got his legs under here.
Cassie: You want me to help you move it against the wall or something?
Josh: I think we need to clean it up a little bit, you know, dust it, something like that.
Cassie: Olivia should be shot for selling this.
Josh: You know what, I'm just glad that we have it.
R.J.: Is this your dad's?
Josh: Yeah, yeah. This is the desk that H.B. was sitting at when he started Lewis Oil. You want to sit down, huh, give it a test run? There you go. ( Laughs ) Pretty cool, huh?
Cassie: Careful.
R.J.: Mom?
Josh: Hang on. Step back just a little bit.
Cassie: What are they?
Josh: Something I didn't expect that I'd ever see again.
[SCENE_BREAK]
( Cell phone rings )
Lizzie: Hello?
Coop: Lizzie, it's me.
Lizzie: Coop, hey, I was just going to call you. Guess what? The baby just kicked.
Coop: Are you sure? That's impossible. You're not that far along yet.
Lizzie: Oh, well, I felt something. I'm sure I did.
Coop: Look, we need to talk.
Lizzie: When?
Coop: Now. I'm...
Lizzie: I can't. I told my mom that I was going to baby-sit James. So, maybe later?
Coop: I'll come to the house then.
Lizzie: No.
Coop: Why not?
Lizzie: Because we wouldn't be all alone. I mean, James would be all over you to play that game that he's always playing. I will call you later. Okay? All right, bye, sweetie.
Coop: Lizzie.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Buzz: Ava? When you have the chance, I've got a private party.
Ava: Oh, sure.
Buzz: This is a baby shower. We have them all the time.
Ava: Yeah, I know.
Buzz: You have something against babies?
Ava: No, I love babies. It's just that any idiot can have one. You have to go through more to adopt a dog or to drive a car than to become a parent. It just makes me crazy.
Buzz: Okay.
Ava: I won't mention it during the shower.
Buzz: Thanks for that.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Frank: No, no, no. I really don't want to do this right now.
Olivia: We're on the date.
Frank: This isn't something, Olivia, that you do on a date, though.
Olivia: Well, it is if you want another one. Frank, please. I don't want to be in the middle of this. You and your father need to sit down and hash this out. Okay, at least sit down with him.
Frank: Olivia, I know you mean well.
Olivia: One of the things I love about us, Frank, is that it started so nice. I don't want to be the woman who tears up the Cooper family. Please. ( Cell phone rings ) Don't answer that.
Frank: I'm sorry.
Olivia: You need to talk...
Frank: I've got to take this. Copper here. What? I'm on my way. There has been a shooting. One of my men are down. I'll call you later.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Officer: Coop, wait, wait.
Dinah: Let her go, let her go, let her go. He's been shot.
Mallet: Yeah, don't remind me, huh?
Harley: How bad is it? Tell me.
Mallet: It looks worse than it is. It's all right. We've got to let these guys do their job, okay?
Harley: Are you all right?
Gus: I'm fine.
Harley: You're not fine. You are white as a sheet. You're trembling. You are not fine. Hey, look at me. What's going on?
Buzz: I thought that was you. Why didn't you come in?
Olivia: I was going to.
Buzz: But?
Olivia: I don't know, I changed my mind.
Buzz: You thought Frank would find us together.
Olivia: No, he was here.
Buzz: Was?
Olivia: One of his officers was shot.
Buzz: Who?
Olivia: I don't know. My dad was in the army. He was an officer. He trained recruits.
Buzz: I think you told me about that.

Olivia: Yeah. He used to drive my mother crazy. She worried about him. Dad told her that she was too nervous, you know, that nothing was going to happen to him. But I don't think it helped much. I could tell because about the time that he was supposed to come home from work, I would find her sitting alone in the living room pretending to read a magazine. But then, you know, at 6:15 my dad would roll in, he'd come through the screen door, and she'd perk up and say, "hi, honey," and he'd kiss her on the cheek. And then she would leave the room, go into the kitchen or whatever. He would plop himself in front of the tv. And a lot of time neither one of them said a word to each other for the rest of the night.
Buzz: That sounds like marriage.

Olivia: I found out later that when they were first married, my dad had been shot. Some kind of accident on the firing range. And then when I was a freshman in high school, it happened again. A weird, freak accident. And he dies. And just like that, life changed. And I know this sounds crazy, but I think that's when I started to expect the worst; probably even made it happen. But it just changed. It changed, Buzz.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Harley: Hey, hey, hey, hey.
Gus: You're going to be okay.
Mallet: Yeah. What's a little hole in the arm, right? The guy was a lousy shot.
Dinah: A lousy shot, he hit him.
Mallet: He was aiming for Gus.
Harley: Mallet, what happened?
Gus: The guy was going into his car and he saw us and he just freaked out...
Mallet: He freaked, yeah, but he was heading to his car. He was coming into the garage.
Gus: He was heading to... from the car.
Harley: Okay, okay. So, what happened? Then you approached him?
Gus: Well, we wanted to show our I.D.'s to the guy and to talk to the guy.
Mallet: Yeah, but we didn't show our I.D.'s, man, he made us for cops right away...
Gus: He showed his I.D...
Mallet: No. I didn't... remember he started shooting as soon as I got out of the car.
Gus: The point is, the guy got away...
Dinah: I don't understand what happened, do you? I don't get it.
Gus: We just wanted to talk to him. We're going to talk to him.
Mallet: Yeah, he's right. We didn't know we were going to become target practice.
Officer: Look, we're ready to transport.
Dinah: Hey, I'm going to come.
Mallet: No, don't come, don't come. I know how you hate the site of blood.
Dinah: I'm going. I'm fine.
Gus: You're going to be... you're going to be okay.
Mallet: Thanks for watching my back, all right. Bye.
Harley: Mallet may be clueless, but I'm not.
Gus: Clu...
Harley: You are high. And your partner almost got killed because of it.
[SCENE_BREAK]
R.J.: Is that, like, as old as the Declaration of Independence?
Josh: Almost, yeah.
Cassie: Well. Josh...
Josh: It's my father's handwriting. I just haven't seen it in a... God, I had completely forgotten about these, you know. But he never did.
R.J.: What is it?

Josh: This was just my father's dream; probably the only one he never actually was never able to live out. Did you know he was a pilot in world war II? In fact, he was a very good one. I'll show you a picture of his plane sometime, okay? He had a drawing of my mom on the side of the plain. ( Laughs )
Cassie: So, then these are blueprints for something?

Josh: Yeah. Um, he and I used to go to a veterans hospital a long way away, and we used to visit a lot of soldiers from a lot of wars. And he always felt like we needed to do something more, that he needed to do something for them.
Cassie: So it's a hospital?
Josh: It is a privately funded medical center and community-- yes, a hospital, and also a rehabilitation center.
Cassie: And it looks like there are places here for their families to stay?
Josh: Yeah. That was so the soldiers could come and go through whatever rehab they had to go through without having to say good-bye to their loved ones.
Cassie: So, why didn't he ever do this?
Josh: It's not like he didn't try. He took it to the board a few times, but he ran into 100 miles of red tape, that kind of thing.
Cassie: Well, I think it's a great idea.
Josh: It's a labor of love.
Cassie: I can see that. Not just for him.
Josh: Well, like I said, we used to visit these guys, you know? I mean, wounded soldiers. It wasn't like he gave up on it. He just ran out of... he ran out of time.
Cassie: Uh-oh.
Josh: What?
Cassie: I can see the wheels turning. You're thinking, "Ooh, I... I have enough time."
Josh: No, I don't have time. I'm busy, very busy.
Cassie: Right.

Josh: But it would be an amazing way to honor him. And our soldiers certainly need this now more than they ever had. It just... it would be practically impossible. I mean, there would be a thousand things that could go wrong. Zoning and funding.
Cassie: Blah, blah, blah...
Josh: I just... it would be a huge, huge project to take on.
Cassie: So, do I have to show you a mirror and show you the look on your face?

Josh: No, I don't think so. I think I can... I'm aware of it. It's just a big... it's actually what I'm looking for, I think. (Laughs ) I mean, to do something other than just build big office buildings-- carry on his legacy.
Cassie: What do you think, R.J?
R.J.: Sounds good to me.
Josh: Me, too.
Cassie: So, H.B. was going to build this right here on the land?
Josh: Yeah, yeah. But see, that was part of the problem. There wasn't enough property to do it, so we would have to get a portion of somebody's else's property to make it work.
Cassie: Well, I don't why that would be a problem. The ranch next door is huge. Who's going to miss a few acres?
Josh: A guy named Buck Larkens, a greedy old coot.
Cassie: Well, we'll have to make him an offer he can't refuse.
Josh: We?
Cassie: You didn't think I was going to let you do this all on your own?

Lizzie: Ashlee, hey.
Ashlee: Hi, Lizzie.
Lizzie: I'm sorry I'm late. I got held up.
Ashlee: It's okay. I wasn't expecting you should show up anyway.
Lizzie: Well, I said I would, didn't I?
Ashlee: Yeah, but you also said that we could go to the movies sometime.
Lizzie: There is not really anything out that I want to see.
Ashlee: That was three years ago.
Lizzie: Oh, I have been so busy.
Ashlee: Yeah, I know. I see your picture in the "Style" section all of the time.

Ashlee: Really?

Ashlee: I can't do that, Lizzie.
Lizzie: Oh, I mean, even as a favor for me? Who would know?

Lizzie: I am.
Ashlee: Wow, who's the father?
Lizzie: My boyfriend, Coop, of course.

Lizzie: Because we're friends, and that's what friends do, right? I mean, unless you don't want to help me.
Ashlee: I do. I do.
Lizzie: Great.
Ashlee: It's just my uncle could lose his license over something like this. And I really would like to help, but I...(buzzer sounds ) I'll be back. Just one minute, okay?
Lizzie: Come on, Ashlee, wait.
Ashlee: One minute.
Lizzie: ( Sighs ) Hey.
Coop: Hi, Lizzie. I just came to help you baby- sit.
Lizzie: Henry Cooper Bradshaw, you followed me. You are so cute.
Coop: What?
Lizzie: You, you're cute for worrying. You're going to make such a good daddy.
Coop: Lizzie, I followed you because you've been avoiding me, and that really makes me wonder.
Lizzie: What?
Coop: You told me you were going to be babysitting your brother.
Lizzie: I was. And then I... I started to not feel good, so I came here.
Coop: This is your doctor's office? Lizzie, it's a free clinic, and not to mention, it's in the worst part of town.
Lizzie: My family happens to fund this clinic, and Dr. Crane is the best.
Coop: Oh, really. Well, I certainly would like to talk to him, find out how everything is coming along, you know.
Lizzie: Oh, yeah. It's just right now is not a good time.
Coop: Oh.
Lizzie: He is way too busy.
Coop: Uh-huh. Too busy for Lizzie Spaulding, hm?
Lizzie: Look, I'm serious, Coop. I'm serious. He is so busy. He was just going to squeeze me in. I didn't even have an appointment. But I actually feel fine now. So, let's come back another time.
Coop: You know what, I really think you don't want me to talk to the doctor, now, do you?
Lizzie: Okay, why would you say something that silly? I'm late to go get James. We will have plenty of time for doctors, believe me. Come on, let's go.
Coop: Whoa, whoa, whoa. You didn't call your mom and tell her about any of this?
Lizzie: Um yeah, she doesn't know yet.
Coop: So, you didn't call her at all? So she has no idea what's going on or that you're going to late?
Lizzie: Oh, no, I called and told her that.
Coop: Well, then that's good. We've got plenty of time then.
Lizzie: But the doctor doesn't.
Ashlee: Hi, can I help you?
Coop: Yes, I'm sure you can.

Josh: So, as you can see, the entire project will encompass about 30 acres, not a whole lot, really.

Buck: You're telling me the place is going to look like a ranch.

Cassie: She is in Paris visiting my niece, Marah. So, what do you think of the plans, Mr. Larkin?
Buck: Call me Buck.

Buck: Opportunity?
Cassie: Yeah.
Josh: Yes, to be part of something that will last, something that will actually make people's lives better.
Buck: You can't argue with that.
Cassie: No, sure can't.

Buck: Just not on my land. I'm sorry, but my land is not for sale.

Rick: Let's move it. Come on. What do we got?
EMT: Gunshot wound to the left shoulder.
Rick: Did it pass through?

Rick: Are you allergic to any medication, Mallet?
Mallet: I don't know, Doc, brussel sprouts. Nothing, man, nothing.
Rick: Cubical one, Let's give him a tetanus shot right away. Let's go. Let's move it.

Rick: It's minor. It's very minor.
Dinah: Can I be there in there with him?
Rick: No, no, you can't.
Dinah: What else can I do? Just tell me.
Rick: You can give some blood, Dinah. We can always use some of that.
Dinah: Okay, I can do that. How much do you need?
Rick: A pint. A pint will be fine. Don't worry. It's going to find. We're going to sew him up and I'll be right out to tell you how it went, okay?
Dinah: Okay.
Nurse: Dr. Bauer asked me to help you with your donation?
Dinah: Oh, yeah.

Gus: Let's go to the hospital for Mallet.
Harley: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Do you know why he is there? Mallet, do you know why he is at the hospital?
Gus: It's not what you think.
Harley: Look at you. Your pupils are the size of a nickels.
Gus: I had a lot of coffee.
Harley: Don't lie to me. You're taking those painkillers.
Gus: I'm not taking...
Harley: Why did you go to Cedars today? Cedars?
Gus: My job.

Harley: Right, right, right. The deposition, right? Because I talked to that Nurse Garrity. She said she never heard of you. It's no deposition. You went there to get pills. Tell the truth. Tell the truth.
Gus: I'm going to the hospital.
Harley: No, no, no. Focus on me. Deal with this. Okay, your partner got shot. You were supposed to be there for him. You come loaded with a gun in your hand? You risked both of your lives.
Gus: That's not what happened.
Harley: Don't lie to me. We talked about this. You admitted you had a problem.
Gus: I had a problem.
Harley: You said you were going to stop taking those pills, not for me, not for you, for our kids, do you remember that?
Gus: I'm not on drugs. I wouldn't do something... you think I would do something like that, go on a detail stoned or high? I'm a professional. I know what would happen.
Harley: You're so high you don't even know what you're talking about right now. That's fine. Lie to yourself. That's fine. But I'm not protecting you. Do you have any idea what could have happened?
Frank: Hey, hey, hey. I just got the call. What happened here?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ricky Paul Golden and Beth Ehlers, "Inside The Light."

Gus: Harley is the love of Gus' life. Beth is A.D.D. Mallet is an ass. Rob's an okay guy, I guess. Alan is a republican, Ron is a democrat. My message to the viewers is, I wouldn't have any of this without them. So from the bottom of my heart, I thank you. See Gus and Harley Wednesday, April 26, "Inside The Light."

Coop: I'm interested in Miss Spaulding's condition and our baby's... how the pregnancy is going, is there anything I should be doing. You see, it's my first visit here, and I'd kind of like to be caught up with everything.

Coop: Well, for starters, yeah.

Coop: You know what, that's okay. I think I've gotten everything I needed. Thank you very much for your time and help.
Ashlee: You're welcome.
Lizzie: Good, great. Let's go. Bye.
Coop: Thanks.

Lizzie: Okay, I'm not mad at you for having trust issues. I'm sure that I deserve it. But we've got to get past it. We've got to be a team now. Oh, oops, I forget to have her write down my next appointment. Wait right here?
Coop: Sure.
Lizzie: Oh, my gosh. Thank you. That was amazing.
Ashlee: Did you think so? Did I help?
Lizzie: Yeah, you were great. What made you change your mind?
Ashlee: I... I just didn't want to disappoint you. But I still don't know why you have to lie to your boyfriend.

Lizzie: Okay, if you knew him, you would understand. I mean, Coop is so nervous. He is worried about the baby, he is worried about everything. He just wants to make sure that I'm taking the best care of myself that I can.
Ashlee: Are you?
Lizzie: I'm trying.

Frank: Take care of that for me, okay? Thanks.
Harley: Mallet will be okay. I mean, he took it in the shoulder. He'll be okay. They'll take care of him at Cedars.
Frank: Yeah, well, thank God because this could have been ten times worse.
Harley: You're telling me.
Gus: It's my fault, Frank. Mallet needed me to be there for him, and I wasn't. I could have been more on top of my game, you know?
Frank: How is that?
Gus: I should have been sharper.
Frank: Hey, look, man, I've been there. I know how you feel.

Harley: He'll read about it in the report. Right, Frank?
Frank: Yeah, yeah. Listen, Gus, don't be so hard on yourself, man. It's not going to solve anything. Just take it easy. Take care of him, will you?
Harley: Take care of Mallet.
Frank: I will.
Gus: Why did you do that? Why did you do that?
Harley: Because I knew where you were going with that thing.

Harley: Just I don't think telling Frank is the right thing right now.
Gus: I'm just trying to come clean, because I wouldn't have taken anything if I knew I was working today.

Gus: Because I want to get better. I needed to take them. I needed to.

Buck: It sounds like a great idea, Josh...
Josh: Just hold on for a second, all right?
Buck: No, I heard all I need to hear.
Josh: Give me a second to make my case.
Buck: You're not going to change my mind.
Josh: Didn't you used to be a marine?
Buck: Look, Josh, it's not a matter of my liking the project. It is a good project. Hell, I'll sign on as a contributor. But my land, well, that's a different story.
Josh: How about if I up the offer just a bit?

Josh: Let me get that.

Josh: No, it's fine.

Buck: It's getting awful lonely over here.

Ava: What are you doing.

Cassie: Well, it was a pleasure to meet you, Buck.
Buck: You, too, Cassie.
Josh: Whoa, whoa, wait a minute, you can't go yet. We still have business to tend to here.
Buck: Not anymore. From now on, your sister-in-law is my go-to man-- I mean, woman. She is a real closer, this little lady.
Cassie: So we will talk tomorrow?
Buck: You know it. Take care, Josh.
Josh: Thank you. What did you do?
Cassie: I got the deal. Isn't that what you wanted?
Josh: Yeah, but you don't look real happy about it.
Cassie: I don't? I'm perfectly happy. Why wouldn't I be happy?
Josh: Cassie, what's wrong?
Cassie: You send me after your neighbor with marching orders on how to close the deal.
Josh: Yeah?
Cassie: Use my past?
Josh: Yeah, what's wrong with that? I just knew that you both had something in common.
Cassie: That he likes strippers? Why would you think that would be okay with me?
Josh: That's not what I said.
Cassie: Oh, I think you were very clear.
Josh: Excuse me.
Cassie: Where are you going?
Josh: I'm going to the shed to find a shovel so I could beat myself over the head for the next 20 minutes.
Cassie: Can I do that?
Josh: Cassie, that's not the past I was talking about, okay?
Cassie: It's not?
Josh: Chicago. He used to be in Chicago, you used to be in Chicago. That's called common ground.
Cassie: Okay. I can't even believe I thought that...
Josh: Yeah, I get that.
Cassie: Can we just pretend that this whole thing never happened?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Frank: You want some coffee?
Dinah: No. Three cups is enough. Thanks anyway. Um, why is this taking so long?
Frank: It's going to be okay.
Dinah: So this is what it's like to date a cop, huh?
Frank: Or be married to one.
Dinah: Whoa, whoa. You can just hold off on the cop thing marriage. Don't jump the gun. Bad choice of words.
Frank: Hey, listen, I'm not going to lie to you. It's not easy having a cop in the family. Just ask my ex-wife. But, you know, if you really love somebody, then I guess you...
Dinah: You live with it. That's what you were going to say.
Frank: Maybe I'm the wrong person to have this conversation with.
Rick: Hey. A miracle worker. Piece of cake.
Dinah: Can I see him?
Rick: Absolutely. Just for a few minutes.
Dinah: Thank you.
Rick: You're welcome.
Rick: He actually wanted me to tell you something. Before he went under, he said to "Tell Dinah that I love her." So, I guess I told you. Pretty sweet.
Dinah: Thank you. I love you, too, you big lug.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Gus: I'm so sorry.
Harley: Yeah. I want you to get better. That's what I want.
Gus: Well, I know what I have to do. This is a wakeup call for me.
Dinah: I'll say.
Gus: I mean it. I mean it.
Harley: You can't do this by yourself.
Gus: I gave it everything I got, though.
Harley: What if that's not enough? Do you trust me?
Gus: With my life.
Harley: Come with me. Come on.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ava: What are you doing. Stop, stop.
Beth: Lizzie, you can't...
Lizzie: Let me go.
Coop: Lizzie, Lizzie...
Lizzie: This is ridiculous.
Ava: You can't... let me go. ( Everyone yelling at the same time )
Frank: All right, everybody, freeze! ( Frank blows whistle ) What the hell is going on here? ( Everyone yelling at the same time ) ( frank blows whistle ) One at a time, please.
Lizzie: Everyone is just a little emotional right now.
Frank: Really?
Lizzie: Look, we're all adults. We're going to process it, we're going to deal with it and finally accept it.
Frank: Uh, accept what, Lizzie?
Lizzie: My pregnancy. Coop and I are going to have a baby, and we're going to be so happy. I just know it. Right, Coop? Coop?
Ava: Congratulations, Lizzie. You finally scared him away.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Josh: Cheers. ( Glasses clink )
Cassie: Cheers. You are going to have to come up with a name for this place.
Josh: That's right, a name. Man, that really makes it seem real, you know.
Cassie: It will be real.
Josh: We've got a long way to go, though.
Cassie: I have no doubt that you're going to get it done. So, what are we going to do next?
Josh: You used the "we" word again.
Cassie: Well, face it. You're going to need me. I think we should talk salary.
Josh: I'm starting to wonder whether or not I'm going to be able to afford you.
Cassie: Yeah, well, probably not. But I think the next phase is raising money for this puppy, and lucky for you I am an ex- princess, so I'm good at this.
Josh: Let's start the negotiations. Take this. Write down a figure. Go ahead.
Cassie: ( Laughs ) All right. How does this fit you?
Josh: ( Laughs ) Hits me in the wallet, and in Reva's pocketbook and in Marah and Shayne's trust fund.
Cassie: All right, all right. I'm just kidding. Is this better?
Josh: We have a deal.
Cassie: Why, yes, I think we do. ( Laughs ) I can't believe this. Reva has been gone, what, a week. She's going to have so many changes to come home to.
Josh: That's what I'm hoping.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Mallet: Oh, man.
Dinah: Take it easy.
Mallet: That's a bummer because I was dreaming, and you were naked.
Dinah: ( Laughs ) Well, I think we could arrange that.
Mallet: Hey.
Dinah: Hey, honey. You know, Frank was here and he said he is going to give you some time off to re-coop.
Mallet: Oh, whoppty-do. I've already got time off. Oh, damn it, I don't think we're going to make it to the Caribbean.
Dinah: Well, you know what, honey. That's all right. It's okay. As long as you're here and you're safe with me, that's all I care about.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Harley: You okay?

Gus: I spend all of my time with drug addicts and alcoholics, and they have to be supervised for 24 hours because they can't handle their addiction, their habit of choice. No, I'm not okay. But here I am. Nice.
Harley: Hey, you know what, I'm not saying a word to anybody. I'll handle it on the QT.
Gus: I don't care what anybody thinks about me, are you kidding me? I only care what you think. And I feel like I let you down, I feel like I disappointed you...
Harley: No, no. No, you haven't. Baby, you make me proud.

Mark: Mr. Aitoro, we're ready for you.
